TopicTitle: [STOCK] TIE Fighter that flies exactly like it should

Articles.Content:
Looks sharp and flies like a dream.

Check out the whole album for a taste of how it handles: http://imgur.com/a/xI7cO

Craft File:[ATTACH]34644[/ATTACH]

Launch instructions: Start the engines and go to full throttle. Once they spool up, pull back on the stick and release the launch clamps. It will kind of just float up into the air like it ain't no thing

Edited October 11, 2012 by iamaphazael

It's bigger than it look like in the screenshot!

It's really easy to control as long as the engines work,then it become a little harder( but it's still easy).

WOW i never even considered on putting those MK2 on the side like that. This has inspired a load of designs i wanna try. Am trying to make a 100% plane that can get to a Planet that looks good and practical.

My hats goes of to you sir

WOW i never even considered on putting those MK2 on the side like that. This has inspired a load of designs i wanna try.

Yeah the mk 2 tanks on the side work pretty well. They're a good way to add extra length to weld wings to.

I had a nice looking, flying-wing concept spaceplane that could make it to keostationary and back, but I lost it when I deleted all my .16 stuff. grrr...
T.I.E (Twin Ion Engine)...to bad a batery with ion engine and solar pannels just would not work in the kerbal world......i cant wait to try this one
This is very awesome and has inspired me for more spaceplane ideas. Thanks!
LOL... i made a X wing recently. Love the starwars themes
this is good but no offence it is a tie interceapter not a fighter but it looks cool all the same

this is good but no offence it is a tie interceapter not a fighter but it looks cool all the same

Actually it looks more like a Tie Advanced (the one Vader flies). The interceptor has twin pronged wings.

Nice craft.
